Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video provided does not show the moment of the terrorist attack in the Brussels airport on 22 March 2016.
Exaggerate: There is no exaggeration bias in the claim.
Understate: There is no understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by providing incorrect information about the video showing the moment of the Brussels airport attack.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or source to back up the assertion that the video shows the moment of the terrorist attack.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video provided is indeed footage of the Brussels airport attack, which is proven to be false.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the video is actually from the 2011 Minsk Metro bombing.
